content.title: Popliteal Artery Entrapment Syndrome Types
content.definition: Compression of the popliteal artery by abnormal anatomic relationships with adjacent musculotendinous structures, leading to claudication and potential arterial damage in young patients.

concepts.definition: Aberrant medial course of popliteal artery around normal medial head of gastrocnemius.

clinical_features.anatomy: Artery courses medial to and beneath medial gastrocnemius head

concepts.definition: Medial insertion of medial gastrocnemius head, artery courses normally.

clinical_features.anatomy: Medial gastrocnemius inserts more laterally than normal
clinical_features.mechanism: Abnormal muscle insertion compresses normally positioned artery

clinical_features.anatomy: Accessory muscle band from medial gastrocnemius
clinical_features.mechanism: Accessory band creates additional compression point

concepts.definition: Popliteal artery compressed by popliteus muscle or fibrous band.

clinical_features.anatomy: Deep entrapment by popliteus or fibrous tissue

concepts.definition: Normal anatomy with functional entrapment from hypertrophied muscles.
Entrapment involving popliteal vein with or without artery.

clinical_features.anatomy: Venous entrapment may occur independently or with arterial

clinical_features.presentation: Young athletic patient with calf claudication
clinical_features.diagnosis: MRI with provocative maneuvers, duplex with plantar flexion
clinical_features.treatment: Surgical release with or without arterial reconstruction

sources.reference: Levien LJ et al. J Vasc Surg. 2018;68:1847-1855
Sinha S et al. Eur J Vasc Endovasc Surg. 2019;57:709-717
